response_metadata.response_text:
{
  "overview": "The purpose of this measure is to appropriate funds for the continued implementation of the Kauhale Initiative and to create the Supportive Housing Special Fund. [CHUNK_1] This fund is designed to assist the Hawaii Housing Finance and Development Corporation in facilitating the development of mixed-income rental housing projects for special needs individuals or families. [CHUNK_2] Your Committee on Finance is in accord with the intent and purpose of H.B. No. 431, H.D. 2, and recommends that it pass Third Reading. [CHUNK_7]",
  "appropriations": "This measure appropriates funds for the continued implementation of the Kauhale Initiative. [CHUNK_1] It also establishes the Supportive Housing Special Fund to assist the Hawaii Housing Finance and Development Corporation. [CHUNK_2] The committee report does not specify any dollar amounts for these appropriations. [CHUNK_0, CHUNK_1, CHUNK_2, CHUNK_3, CHUNK_4, CHUNK_5, CHUNK_6, CHUNK_7]",
  "assumptions_and_methodology": "The fiscal plan is based on the need to facilitate the development of mixed-income rental housing projects for special needs individuals or families who require supportive services. [CHUNK_2] The measure aims to create a dedicated financing tool, the Supportive Housing Special Fund, to address this need. [CHUNK_2] The measure also assumes the need for continued implementation of the Kauhale Initiative. [CHUNK_1]",
  "agency_impact": "The Hawaii Housing Finance and Development Corporation is tasked with administering the new Supportive Housing Special Fund. [CHUNK_2] The sums appropriated for the Kauhale Initiative shall be expended by the office of the governor. [CHUNK_1] The Committee on Finance received comments on this measure from the Department of Budget and Finance, Department of Human Services, State Procurement Office, and Hawaii Housing Finance and Development Corporation. [CHUNK_6]",
  "economic_impact": "This measure aims to address housing insecurity by creating a Supportive Housing Special Fund to facilitate the development of mixed-income rental housing projects. [CHUNK_2] It also provides continued funding for the Kauhale Initiative. [CHUNK_1] Testimony in support was received from numerous community and government organizations, reflecting broad support for addressing housing needs. [CHUNK_3, CHUNK_4, CHUNK_5]",
  "policy_impact": "This measure creates the Supportive Housing Special Fund to assist the Hawaii Housing Finance and Development Corporation. [CHUNK_2] It also appropriates funds for the continued implementation of the Kauhale Initiative. [CHUNK_1] The bill modifies state housing policy by establishing a new dedicated fund for supportive housing projects. [CHUNK_2]",
  "revenue_sources": "The measure appropriates funds, implying a general fund source for the Kauhale Initiative and the initial capitalization of the Supportive Housing Special Fund. [CHUNK_1] The Supportive Housing Special Fund is structured to facilitate development of rental housing projects, though the specifics of its revenue sources are not detailed in the committee report. [CHUNK_2] Testimony was received from a wide range of organizations in support of the measure. [CHUNK_4, CHUNK_5]",
  "six_year_fiscal_implications": "The measure appropriates unspecified funds for the continued implementation of the Kauhale Initiative. [CHUNK_1] It also creates the Supportive Housing Special Fund to facilitate the development of mixed-income rental housing projects. [CHUNK_2] Since the appropriations are unspecified, the precise multi-year fiscal impact cannot be determined from the committee report. [CHUNK_1] The establishment of a permanent special fund suggests an ongoing fiscal commitment to supportive housing. [CHUNK_2] This fund would support projects for special needs individuals or families who require supportive services. [CHUNK_2] Continued operation of the Kauhale Initiative will also likely require future appropriations. [CHUNK_1] The Committee on Finance is in accord with the intent and purpose of the measure. [CHUNK_7] However, no specific long-term cost projections are provided in the documentation. [CHUNK_0, CHUNK_1, CHUNK_2, CHUNK_3, CHUNK_4, CHUNK_5, CHUNK_6, CHUNK_7] The bill, H.B. No. 431, H.D. 2, will be forwarded for Third Reading. [CHUNK_7] No other fiscal implications are detailed. [CHUNK_6]",
  "operating_revenue_impact": "The provided committee report does not contain information regarding impacts on operating revenues. [CHUNK_0, CHUNK_1, CHUNK_2, CHUNK_3, CHUNK_4, CHUNK_5, CHUNK_6, CHUNK_7]",
  "capital_expenditure_impact": "Funds are appropriated for the continued implementation of the Kauhale Initiative, which may involve capital expenditures. [CHUNK_1] The Supportive Housing Special Fund is created to facilitate the development of mixed-income rental housing projects, which represents a significant capital investment purpose. [CHUNK_2] The specific impact on capital expenditures is not quantified in the provided committee report. [CHUNK_0, CHUNK_1, CHUNK_2, CHUNK_3, CHUNK_4, CHUNK_5, CHUNK_6, CHUNK_7]",
  "fiscal_implications_after_6_years": "The creation of the Supportive Housing Special Fund suggests a long-term commitment to financing housing projects for special needs individuals or families. [CHUNK_2] The continued implementation of the Kauhale Initiative also implies ongoing fiscal obligations. [CHUNK_1] However, the provided committee report does not detail fiscal implications beyond the immediate scope of the bill. [CHUNK_0, CHUNK_1, CHUNK_2, CHUNK_3, CHUNK_4, CHUNK_5, CHUNK_6, CHUNK_7]",
  "updates_from_previous_fiscal_note": "The Committee on Finance reviewed H.B. No. 431, H.D. 2 and recommends that it pass Third Reading. [CHUNK_7] This committee report does not introduce any amendments to the bill's text. [CHUNK_0, CHUNK_1, CHUNK_2, CHUNK_3, CHUNK_4, CHUNK_5, CHUNK_6, CHUNK_7] Consequently, all fiscal elements from the previous analysis of H.B. No. 431, H.D. 2, including its unspecified appropriations and other provisions, remain unchanged. [CHUNK_7]",
  "fte_positions": "The provided committee report does not contain information regarding Full Time Equivalent (FTE) positions. [CHUNK_0, CHUNK_1, CHUNK_2, CHUNK_3, CHUNK_4, CHUNK_5, CHUNK_6, CHUNK_7]",
  "appropriations_changes": "The provided committee report does not specify any changes to appropriations. [CHUNK_0, CHUNK_1, CHUNK_2, CHUNK_3, CHUNK_4, CHUNK_5, CHUNK_6, CHUNK_7] The purpose of the measure remains to appropriate funds for the Kauhale Initiative and create the Supportive Housing Special Fund. [CHUNK_1] The report recommends the bill pass Third Reading without amendment to its appropriation sections. [CHUNK_7]",
  "funding_sources_changes": "The provided committee report does not contain information regarding changes to funding sources. [CHUNK_0, CHUNK_1, CHUNK_2, CHUNK_3, CHUNK_4, CHUNK_5, CHUNK_6, CHUNK_7]",
  "department_impact": "The measure directs the Hawaii Housing Finance and Development Corporation to facilitate the development of mixed-income rental housing projects via the new special fund. [CHUNK_2] The committee report does not specify any changes to departmental responsibilities from the underlying bill, H.B. No. 431, H.D. 2. [CHUNK_7]",
  "reports_required": "The provided committee report does not contain information regarding reporting requirements. [CHUNK_0, CHUNK_1, CHUNK_2, CHUNK_3, CHUNK_4, CHUNK_5, CHUNK_6, CHUNK_7]",
  "pilot_program": "The provided committee report does not contain information regarding a pilot program. [CHUNK_0, CHUNK_1, CHUNK_2, CHUNK_3, CHUNK_4, CHUNK_5, CHUNK_6, CHUNK_7]",
  "sunset_date": "The provided committee report does not contain information regarding a sunset date. [CHUNK_0, CHUNK_1, CHUNK_2, CHUNK_3, CHUNK_4, CHUNK_5, CHUNK_6, CHUNK_7]",
  "effective_date": "The provided committee report does not contain information regarding the effective date of the measure. [CHUNK_0, CHUNK_1, CHUNK_2, CHUNK_3, CHUNK_4, CHUNK_5, CHUNK_6, CHUNK_7]"
}

parts.text:
{
  "overview": "The purpose of this measure is to appropriate funds for the continued implementation of the Kauhale Initiative and to create the Supportive Housing Special Fund. [CHUNK_1] This fund is designed to assist the Hawaii Housing Finance and Development Corporation in facilitating the development of mixed-income rental housing projects for special needs individuals or families. [CHUNK_2] Your Committee on Finance is in accord with the intent and purpose of H.B. No. 431, H.D. 2, and recommends that it pass Third Reading. [CHUNK_7]",
  "appropriations": "This measure appropriates funds for the continued implementation of the Kauhale Initiative. [CHUNK_1] It also establishes the Supportive Housing Special Fund to assist the Hawaii Housing Finance and Development Corporation. [CHUNK_2] The committee report does not specify any dollar amounts for these appropriations. [CHUNK_0, CHUNK_1, CHUNK_2, CHUNK_3, CHUNK_4, CHUNK_5, CHUNK_6, CHUNK_7]",
  "assumptions_and_methodology": "The fiscal plan is based on the need to facilitate the development of mixed-income rental housing projects for special needs individuals or families who require supportive services. [CHUNK_2] The measure aims to create a dedicated financing tool, the Supportive Housing Special Fund, to address this need. [CHUNK_2] The measure also assumes the need for continued implementation of the Kauhale Initiative. [CHUNK_1]",
  "agency_impact": "The Hawaii Housing Finance and Development Corporation is tasked with administering the new Supportive Housing Special Fund. [CHUNK_2] The sums appropriated for the Kauhale Initiative shall be expended by the office of the governor. [CHUNK_1] The Committee on Finance received comments on this measure from the Department of Budget and Finance, Department of Human Services, State Procurement Office, and Hawaii Housing Finance and Development Corporation. [CHUNK_6]",
  "economic_impact": "This measure aims to address housing insecurity by creating a Supportive Housing Special Fund to facilitate the development of mixed-income rental housing projects. [CHUNK_2] It also provides continued funding for the Kauhale Initiative. [CHUNK_1] Testimony in support was received from numerous community and government organizations, reflecting broad support for addressing housing needs. [CHUNK_3, CHUNK_4, CHUNK_5]",
  "policy_impact": "This measure creates the Supportive Housing Special Fund to assist the Hawaii Housing Finance and Development Corporation. [CHUNK_2] It also appropriates funds for the continued implementation of the Kauhale Initiative. [CHUNK_1] The bill modifies state housing policy by establishing a new dedicated fund for supportive housing projects. [CHUNK_2]",
  "revenue_sources": "The measure appropriates funds, implying a general fund source for the Kauhale Initiative and the initial capitalization of the Supportive Housing Special Fund.   "six_year_fiscal_implications": "The measure appropriates unspecified funds for the continued implementation of the Kauhale Initiative. No. 431, H.D. 2, will be forwarded for Third Reading. [CHUNK_7] No other fiscal implications are detailed. [CHUNK_6]",
  "operating_revenue_impact": "The provided committee report does not contain information regarding impacts on operating revenues. [CHUNK_0, CHUNK_1, CHUNK_2, CHUNK_3, CHUNK_4, CHUNK_5, CHUNK_6, CHUNK_7]",
  "capital_expenditure_impact": "Funds are appropriated for the continued implementation of the Kauhale Initiative, which may involve capital expenditures. [CHUNK_1] The Supportive Housing Special Fund is created to facilitate the development of mixed-income rental housing projects, which represents a significant capital investment purpose.   "fiscal_implications_after_6_years": "The creation of the Supportive Housing Special Fund suggests a long-term commitment to financing housing projects for special needs individuals or families. [CHUNK_2] The continued implementation of the Kauhale Initiative also implies ongoing fiscal obligations. [CHUNK_1] However, the provided committee report does not detail fiscal implications beyond the immediate scope of the bill. [CHUNK_0, CHUNK_1, CHUNK_2, CHUNK_3, CHUNK_4, CHUNK_5, CHUNK_6, CHUNK_7]",
  "updates_from_previous_fiscal_note": "The Committee on Finance reviewed H.B. No. 431, H.D. 2 and recommends that it pass Third Reading. chunk_details.chunk_text: HSCR962 STAND. COM. REP. NO. 962 Honolulu, Hawaii , 2025 RE: H.B. No. 431 H.D. 2 Honorable Nadine K. Nakamura Speaker, House of Representatives Thirty-Third State Legislature Regular Session of 2025 State of Hawaii Madame: Your Committee on Finance, to which was referred H.B. No. 431, H.D. 2, entitled: "A

which was referred H.B. No. 431, H.D. 2, entitled: "A BILL FOR AN ACT RELATING TO HOUSING," begs leave to report as follows: The purpose of this measure is to: (1) Appropriate funds for the continued implementation of the Kauhale Initiative; and (2) Create the Supportive Housing Special Fund to

Initiative; and (2) Create the Supportive Housing Special Fund to assist the Hawaii Housing Finance and Development Corporation to facilitate the development of mixed-income rental housing projects in which some or all the units are targeted to special needs individuals or families who require supportive services. Your Committee received testimony

or families who require supportive services. Your Committee received testimony in support of this measure from the Office of Hawaiian Affairs; State Council on Developmental Disabilities; Hawai ʻ i State Youth Commission; Office of Housing of the City and County of Honolulu; Hawaii Substance Abuse Coalition; Catholic Charities Hawai ʻ

of Honolulu; Hawaii Substance Abuse Coalition; Catholic Charities Hawai ʻ i; The Institute for Human Services, Inc.; Hawai ʻ i Community Foundation; Young Democrats of Hawai ʻ i; Hawai ʻ i Health & Harm Reduction Center; Hawaii Appleseed Cetner for Law & Economic Justice; Partners in Care - O ʻ

Law & Economic Justice; Partners in Care - O ʻ ahu Continuum of Care; Maui Chamber of Commerce; LIMBY Hawai ʻ i; Pacific Housing Assistance Corporation; and Hawaii Young Adults in Transition. Your Committee received comments on this measure from the Department of Budget and Finance; Department of Human Services;

the Department of Budget and Finance; Department of Human Services; State Procurement Office; and Hawaii Housing Finance and Development Corporation. As affirmed by the record of votes of the members of your Committee on Finance that is attached to this report, your Committee is in accord with the intent and

report, your Committee is in accord with the intent and purpose of H.B. No. 431, H.D. 2, and recommends that it pass Third Reading. Respectfully submitted on behalf of the members of the Committee on Finance, ____________________________ KYLE T. YAMASHITA, Chair

Your Committee received comments on this measure from the Department of Budget and Finance; Department of Human Services;

the Department of Budget and Finance; Department of Human Services; State Procurement Office; and Hawaii Housing Finance and Development Corporation. As affirmed by the record of votes of the members of your Committee on Finance that is attached to this report, your Committee is in accord with the intent and

report, your Committee is in accord with the intent and purpose of H.B. No. 431, H.D. 2, and recommends that it pass Third Reading. Respectfully submitted on behalf of the members of the Committee on Finance, ____________________________ KYLE T. YAMASHITA, Chair

Nakamura Speaker, House of Representatives Thirty-Third State Legislature Regular Session of 2025 State of Hawaii Madame: Your Committee on Finance, to which was referred H.B. No. 431, H.D. 2, entitled: "A

which was referred H.B. No. 431, H.D. 2, entitled: "A BILL FOR AN ACT RELATING TO HOUSING," begs leave to report as follows: The purpose of this measure is to: (1) Appropriate funds for the continued implementation of the Kauhale Initiative; and (2) Create the Supportive Housing Special Fund to

Initiative; and (2) Create the Supportive Housing Special Fund to assist the Hawaii Housing Finance and Development Corporation to facilitate the development of mixed-income rental housing projects in which some or all the units are targeted to special needs individuals or families who require supportive services. Your Committee received testimony

or families who require supportive services. overview.prompt: Using the provided legislative documents, statutes, and testimonies, write a clear summary describing the purpose, scope, and key components of the proposed measure or bill, including any pilot or permanent programs, reporting requirements, and sunset clauses. This should be around 3 sentences.
overview.description: General overview and summary of the measure

appropriations.prompt: Based on budgetary data and legislative appropriations, detail the funding allocated for the program or measure, including fiscal years, amounts, intended uses such as staffing, training, contracts, technology, etc... This should be around 3 sentences.

assumptions_and_methodology.prompt: Explain the assumptions, cost estimation methods, and data sources used to calculate the financial projections for this program or measure, referencing comparable programs or historical budgets where applicable. This should be around 3 sentences.

agency_impact.prompt: Describe the anticipated operational, administrative, and budgetary impact of the program or measure on the relevant government agency or department, including supervision, staffing, and resource allocation. This should be around 3 sentences.
agency_impact.description: Impact on government agencies and departments

economic_impact.prompt: Summarize the expected economic effects of the program or measure, such as cost savings, potential reductions in related expenditures, benefits to the community, and any relevant performance or participation statistics. This should be around 3 sentences.

policy_impact.prompt: Analyze the policy implications of the measure, including how it modifies existing laws or programs, its role within broader legislative strategies, and its potential effects on state or local governance. This should be around 3 sentences.

revenue_sources.prompt: Identify and describe the funding sources that will support the program or measure, such as general funds, grants, fees, or other revenue streams, based on the provided fiscal documents. This should be around 3 sentences.

six_year_fiscal_implications.prompt: Provide a multi-year fiscal outlook (e.g., six years) for the program or measure, projecting costs, staffing changes, recurring expenses, and assumptions about program expansion or permanence using available budget and workload data. This should be around 10 sentences.

operating_revenue_impact.prompt: Describe any anticipated impacts on operating revenues resulting from the program or measure, including increases, decreases, or changes in revenue streams. This should be around 3 sentences.

capital_expenditure_impact.prompt: Outline any expected capital expenditures related to the program or measure, such as investments in facilities, equipment, or technology infrastructure, based on capital budgets or agency plans. This should be around 3 sentences.

fiscal_implications_after_6_years.prompt: Summarize the ongoing fiscal obligations after the initial multi-year period for the program or measure, including annual operating costs, expected number of program sites or units, and the sustainability of funding. This should be around 3 sentences.
fiscal_implications_after_6_years.description: Long-term fiscal obligations beyond six years

updates_from_previous_fiscal_note.prompt: If you are given a previous fiscal note. Please summarize the MAIN POINTS that are different from the previous fiscal note and the new fiscal note.

fte_positions.prompt: Detail any Full Time Equivalent (FTE) positions that have been added or modified in this version of the bill, including the number of positions, their roles, and any changes from previous versions. This should be around 3 sentences.

appropriations_changes.prompt: Identify and describe any appropriations that were previously unspecified or have been modified between versions of the bill, including the amounts and purposes of the appropriations. This should be around 3 sentences.
appropriations_changes.description: Changes to appropriations between bill versions

funding_sources_changes.prompt: Specify the method of funding (MOF) for appropriations and identify any changes in funding sources between versions, such as shifts between general fund and special fund appropriations. This should be around 3 sentences.
funding_sources_changes.description: Changes to funding sources and method of funding

department_impact.prompt: Describe any changes in which department is responsible for expending appropriations, including shifts from one department to another between bill versions (e.g., from Department of Health to Judiciary). This should be around 3 sentences.
department_impact.description: Changes in department responsibility for appropriations

reports_required.prompt: Identify any reports that agencies are required to submit to the legislature, including new reporting requirements or modifications to existing ones. This should be around 3 sentences.

pilot_program.prompt: If the bill creates a pilot program, describe the length of the pilot program and whether it was initially intended to be a pilot program or a permanent program. This should be around 3 sentences.

sunset_date.prompt: Identify the sunset date for the bill or program, including any modifications to the sunset date between versions. This should be around 2 sentences.

effective_date.prompt: Identify the effective date of the bill, noting if there was a defective effective date in a previous version and what the corrected effective date is. This should be around 2 sentences.
